meanings.definition: A concluding section of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The epilog neatly wrapped up the story in the book.
meanings.sent2: I always look forward to reading the epilog at the end of a novel.
meanings.sent3: The epilog in the play had the audience laughing with its clever twist.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like an epilog, tying up all loose ends in a satisfying way.
meanings.sent5: The epilog left a lasting impression on the readers, bringing closure to the narrative.

meanings.definition: A speech or piece of writing at the end of a play or book.
meanings.sent1: The emotional epilog delivered by the main character moved the audience to tears.
meanings.sent2: The epilog in the book summarized the protagonist's journey beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The epilog was so heartfelt that it made the audience reflect on their own lives.
meanings.sent4: Her words in the epilog echoed in his mind long after the play had ended.
meanings.sent5: The epilog was a powerful reminder of the themes explored throughout the story.

meanings.definition: The final section of a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The epilog of the symphony left the audience in awe of the composer's talent.
meanings.sent2: The musicians played the epilog with passion and precision.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected key change in the epilog surprised everyone in the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: The epilog of the opera felt like a grand finale, leaving the audience cheering.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the epilog lingered in the air long after the performance had ended.
